title: LRS Announces Grand Opening of The Exchange, a Revolutionary Material Recovery Facility Pioneering a New Era of ... - PR Newswire
summary: LRS announces the opening of The Exchange, a cutting-edge material recovery facility in Chicago, showcasing the company's commitment to waste diversion and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE - The Exchange material recovery facility is a green innovation as it focuses on significantly diverting waste from landfills and reducing the carbon footprint of waste and recycling processes.
business_innovation: TRUE - The Exchange facility is a business innovation as it is a new state-of-the-art material recovery facility that differs significantly from LRS' previous waste management processes.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not specifically mention any new green product.
green_process: TRUE - The Exchange facility is a green process innovation as it aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, and promote sustainability in waste management and recycling practices.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562111 - Solid waste collection, 562998 - All other miscellaneous waste management services, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities
greenwashing: FALSE - The article highlights tangible efforts and investments made by LRS to improve waste management and recycling practices, without any indication of false or misleading environmental claims.

title: New Recycling Facility Redefines ‘State of the Art’ - Business West
summary: The article discusses the All American Material Recovery Facility (MRF) in Berlin, which excels in recycling processes and innovative technologies, distinguishing itself in the recycling industry.
green_innovation: TRUE This is a green innovation as the All American Material Recovery Facility contributes to environmental sustainability by enhancing recycling processes and reducing waste.
business_innovation: FALSE This article focuses on green and recycling processes rather than new products or business processes.
green_product: FALSE The article discusses a recycling facility rather than a specific good or service designed to reduce environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE The article highlights green processes in the recycling industry that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 (Materials Recovery Facilities), 562998 (All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services), 562111 (Solid Waste Collection), 562112 (Hazardous Waste Collection)
greenwashing: FALSE This is not an example of greenwashing as the article focuses on the actual environmental benefits and processes of the recycling facility.

title: Rolling car tires into the global circular economy - Mongabay.com
summary: The article discusses the environmental challenges posed by the disposal of over 1 billion car tires annually, highlighting the need for circular economy solutions to tackle pollution. Various solutions such as increasing tire longevity, alternative rubber sourcing, and recycling methods like devulcanization and pyrolysis are explored. The complexity in tire composition and the environmental impacts across the lifecycle are emphasized, necessitating innovative and sustainable approaches for waste tire management.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325211 - Tire Manufacturing, 562112 - Hazardous Waste Collection, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 562991 - Septic Tank and Related Services

title: Fletcher Building to replace old particleboard line in Taupo with new Fine OSB plant - Lesprom Network
summary: Fletcher Building Limited has ordered a complete CEBRO plant for the production of Fine OSB from Dieffenbacher to be built in Taupo, New Zealand, incorporating sustainable technologies for energy efficiency and operational excellence.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes the implementation of a sustainable plant concept (CEBRO) that focuses on sustainability as one of its key pillars, exemplifying green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE, The introduction of a new plant (CEBRO) and production processes by Fletcher Building Limited represents a significant business innovation in its operations and product offerings.
green_product: TRUE, The article discusses the production of Fine OSB, a green product that aims to reduce environmental impact through sustainable design, manufacturing, and usage practices.
green_process: TRUE, The article highlights the utilization of sustainable processes and technologies in the manufacturing of Fine OSB, indicating a commitment to minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 321211 - Hardwood Plywood and Veneer Manufacturing, 321212 - Softwood Plywood and Veneer Manufacturing, 321213 - Engineered Wood Member (except Truss) Manufacturing, 321999 - All Other Miscellaneous Wood Product Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, The article describes genuine efforts by Fletcher Building Limited and Dieffenbacher to incorporate sustainable practices and technologies in the production of Fine OSB, rather than engaging in greenwashing.
